details.description: Includes getting a driving licence, changing your address, fees and tracking your application

Book your driving test or get a tax disc online, find out the legal requirements for buying, owning, importing or scrapping a car or motorcycle, and read about your rights and responsibilities as a driver.

related.title: Change the address on your driving licence

details.description: Find out what information DVLA holds about your driving licence
details.alternate_methods:
Use the old service

You’ll need to have the following to use the old service:

  • a Government Gateway account
  • a photocard licence that you applied for online (eg you applied for a provisional licence or replaced your licence online)

Ask for your driving licence information by post

To see what information the DVLA holds on your driving licence you can either send a request form or a letter with the following information to the DVLA:

  • your full name and address
  • your driver licence number (or your date of birth if you don’t know your driver number)

You must include a cheque or postal order for £5 payable to ‘DVLA, Swansea’.

Send your request to:

Driver Licence Validation Service
DVRE 5
D7
DVLA
Swansea
SA99 1AJ

It’s a criminal offence to obtain someone else’s personal information without their permission.
details.introduction: Find out what information DVLA holds about your driving licence
details.more_information:
You’ll need to have the following to use this service:

  • your driving licence number
  • your National Insurance number
  • the postcode on your driving licence

What you can find out

The following information is held on your records:

  • what sort of vehicles you can drive
  • details of any penalty points or fines
  • when your licence expires
  • personal details, eg date and place of birth

You can’t use this service to change your address.
